devdoc.author: - @Mr-Biskit, @pokhrelanmol, @mengiefen, @Rushikesh0125 and @NicoTollenaar
devdoc.details: - All function calls are currently implemented without side effects The contract uses OpenZeppelin's contracts for ERC20 and ERC721 to handle token transfers. The contract also uses its own libraries for trade validation, security functions and the Trade Data Structure.

addTrade((uint256,address,address,(addre.details: - The trade is created by the seller, takes the trade data as input and transfers the tokens, NFTs or ETH to the contract.  The trade is then added to the state variables and the trade ID is incremented.

cancelTrade(uint256).details: - The trade is canceled by the seller, takes the trade ID as input and transfers the tokens, NFTs or ETH back to the seller.

checkExpiredTrades().details: - Checks if a trade is expired and updates the trade status

confirmTrade(uint256).details: - The trade is confirmed by the buyer, takes the trade ID as input and transfers the tokens, NFTs or ETH to the seller. The tokens, NFT or ETH is transferred to the buyer from the contract.

withdraw(uint256).details: - Withdraws the asset from the contract, takes the trade ID as input and transfers the tokens, NFTs or ETH to the seller.

devdoc.title: TrustMe - A decentralized settlement platform for ETH, ERC20 tokens and ERC721 NFTs

checkExpiredTrades().notice: - Checks if a trade is expired

withdraw(uint256).notice: - Withdraws the asset from the contract

userdoc.notice: - Use this contract to create, confirm, cancel and withdraw settlements
